intro: Calcitrapa pungens, commonly known as the stinging nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its hollow, hairless stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is known for its stinging hairs that cause irritation upon contact with the skin. Native to temperate regions, it thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Calcitrapa pungens has been used historically for its medicinal properties and as a food source.
